alert.note: Alert for Fergus; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:10PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Judith Basin and Fergus Counties through at least 545 PM MDT... At 507 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms over much of Fergus County and mainly over the eastern half of Judith Basin County, moving northeast at 55 mph. Storms may redevelop over the Little Belt Mountains and move east over the area as well. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Stanford, Denton, Hobson, Winifred, Moore, Grass Range, Geyser, Roy, Fergus, Windham, Forestgrove, Sapphire Village, Utica, Danvers, Valentine, Hilger, Buffalo, Moccasin and Fred Robinson Bridge. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 16 and 123. Highway 191 between mile markers 1 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
